txt.en:
'You are a hunter of great ability, [placeholder], but unless you learn your way around the desolate crags of Angmar, you may still come to a sad end there.

'You should seek out Torcall, for he is a worthy hunter and could tell you much of the secret paths through Angmar.

'Look for Torcall at Aughaire in West Angmar, but be warned: you will need to prove that you are worthy of his teachings or he will tell you nothing.'

'You are a hunter of great ability, [placeholder], but unless you learn your way around the desolate crags of Angmar, you may still come to a sad end there.

'You should seek out Torcall, for he is a worthy hunter and could tell you much of the secret paths through Angmar.

'Look for Torcall at Aughaire in West Angmar, but be warned: you will need to prove that you are worthy of his teachings or he will tell you nothing.'
Hunter: Desolation by Aughaire

'You are a hunter of great ability, [placeholder], but unless you learn your way around the desolate crags of Angmar, you may still come to a sad end there.

'You should seek out Torcall, for he is a worthy hunter and could tell you much of the secret paths through Angmar.

'Look for Torcall at Aughaire in West Angmar, but be warned: you will need to prove that you are worthy of his teachings or he will tell you nothing.'

'You are a hunter of great ability, [placeholder], but unless you learn your way around the desolate crags of Angmar, you may still come to a sad end there.

'You should seek out Torcall, for he is a worthy hunter and could tell you much of the secret paths through Angmar.

'Look for Torcall at Aughaire in West Angmar, but be warned: you will need to prove that you are worthy of his teachings or he will tell you nothing.'
'I left by the north road, [placeholder]. You will need to pick up my trail from there and follow it until you recover the Orc-skull.'

'You call yourself a hunter? We will see, [placeholder]. We will see.

'If you are a true hunter, you will be able to follow the trail I took when last I hunted the Orcs of Angmar. I left by the north road from Aughaire. If you can follow my trail, you will find the skull of one of the Orcs I slew.

'Return to me with this Orc-skull, and I will show you what I know of the secret ways through Angmar. You will be able to come to Aughaire with speed far-exceeding that of lesser hunters.'

'You are a hunter of great ability, [placeholder], but unless you learn your way around the desolate crags of Angmar, you may still come to a sad end there.

'You should seek out Torcall, for he is a worthy hunter and could tell you much of the secret paths through Angmar.

'Look for Torcall at Aughaire in West Angmar, but be warned: you will need to prove that you are worthy of his teachings or he will tell you nothing.'
'You will find Torcall at Aughaire, in West Angmar, if you are interested in learning the secret ways through the desolation of that fell land.'

'You are a hunter of great ability, [placeholder], but unless you learn your way around the desolate crags of Angmar, you may still come to a sad end there.

'You should seek out Torcall, for he is a worthy hunter and could tell you much of the secret paths through Angmar.

'Look for Torcall at Aughaire in West Angmar, but be warned: you will need to prove that you are worthy of his teachings or he will tell you nothing.'
Torcall is at Aughaire, in West Angmar.\n\nYou have been told to speak with Torcall, one of the Hillmen at Aughaire, about secret paths through the desolation of Angmar.
'You will find Torcall at Aughaire, in West Angmar, if you are interested in learning the secret ways through the desolation of that fell land.'

'You are a hunter of great ability, [placeholder], but unless you learn your way around the desolate crags of Angmar, you may still come to a sad end there.

'You should seek out Torcall, for he is a worthy hunter and could tell you much of the secret paths through Angmar.

'Look for Torcall at Aughaire in West Angmar, but be warned: you will need to prove that you are worthy of his teachings or he will tell you nothing.'

Torcall has hidden an Orc-skull somewhere within West Angmar.\n\nYou have been challenged to recover an Orc-skull that Torcall says is hidden somewhere in West Angmar. He left by the road north of Aughaire and slew an Orc at some point along his journey; if you follow his trail, you may be able to find it.
'You will find Torcall at Aughaire, in West Angmar, if you are interested in learning the secret ways through the desolation of that fell land.'

'You are a hunter of great ability, [placeholder], but unless you learn your way around the desolate crags of Angmar, you may still come to a sad end there.

'You should seek out Torcall, for he is a worthy hunter and could tell you much of the secret paths through Angmar.

'Look for Torcall at Aughaire in West Angmar, but be warned: you will need to prove that you are worthy of his teachings or he will tell you nothing.'
Torcall is in Aughaire, in West Angmar.\n\nYou have recovered the Orc-skull Torcall asked you to find and should now return it to him as proof of your skill as a hunter.
'You will find Torcall at Aughaire, in West Angmar, if you are interested in learning the secret ways through the desolation of that fell land.'
'You will find Torcall at Aughaire, in West Angmar, if you are interested in learning the secret ways through the desolation of that fell land.'

'You will find Torcall at Aughaire, in West Angmar, if you are interested in learning the secret ways through the desolation of that fell land.'
'You are welcome in Aughaire, [placeholder].'
Find the Orc-skull
'Do not let down your guard. West Angmar is full of danger.'
Bring Orc-skull to Torcall

'You are a hunter of great ability, [placeholder], but unless you learn your way around the desolate crags of Angmar, you may still come to a sad end there.

'You should seek out Torcall, for he is a worthy hunter and could tell you much of the secret paths through Angmar.

'Look for Torcall at Aughaire in West Angmar, but be warned: you will need to prove that you are worthy of his teachings or he will tell you nothing.'
A number of tracks can be seen among the loose stones here, but it is impossible to tell what might have made them or how long ago. It does not seem likely that Torcall came this way.
You have found Torcall's trail, but here it becomes confused and muddled among the stones. You cannot tell in which direction he left this place.
A battered Orc-skull lies among the stones. It is coated with a thin layer of ash and dust.
Judging from the signs, the trail here turns to the east.
Your keen eye detects that the trail here bends to the north.
The trail here runs north-east among the loose stones.

'You call yourself a hunter? We will see, [placeholder]. We will see.

'If you are a true hunter, you will be able to follow the trail I took when last I hunted the Orcs of Angmar. I left by the north road from Aughaire. If you can follow my trail, you will find the skull of one of the Orcs I slew.

'Return to me with this Orc-skull, and I will show you what I know of the secret ways through Angmar. You will be able to come to Aughaire with speed far-exceeding that of lesser hunters.'
You have been encouraged to learn the ways of the desolate crags of West Angmar, so you may better find the way to Aughaire when needed.

'This is the skull of which I spoke, [placeholder]. You are a skilled hunter, and I will teach you what I know of the secret paths through these lands.\n\n'You will be able to lead your allies to Aughaire with great speed, if you pay attention to the signs and to what I have told you.'
'You do not have the Orc-skull? You will not have my teachings either.'

'You are a hunter of great ability, [placeholder], but unless you learn your way around the desolate crags of Angmar, you may still come to a sad end there.

'You should seek out Torcall, for he is a worthy hunter and could tell you much of the secret paths through Angmar.

'Look for Torcall at Aughaire in West Angmar, but be warned: you will need to prove that you are worthy of his teachings or he will tell you nothing.'
